intro: Plantinia aspera, commonly known as the roughleaf plantain, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring broad, lance-shaped leaves with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their anti-inflammatory and healing properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is commonly found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed habitats.
